body_html:
existing:

>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor with indices:

[torch.LongTensor with no dimension]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor with no dimension]
[torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)]

There are a couple of issues with this:

  • the no dimension thing is wrong, because empty variables now have size (0,)
  • the double footer at the bottom is confusing because it's nested.

This changes the printing to more closely follow the dense printing:

>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)
with indices:

[torch.LongTensor of size (0,)]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor of size (0,)]
body_text:
existing:
>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor with indices:

[torch.LongTensor with no dimension]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor with no dimension]
[torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)]

There are a couple of issues with this:

the no dimension thing is wrong, because empty variables now have size (0,)
the double footer at the bottom is confusing because it's nested.

This changes the printing to more closely follow the dense printing:
>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)
with indices:

[torch.LongTensor of size (0,)]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor of size (0,)]
body:
existing:
```
>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor with indices:

[torch.LongTensor with no dimension]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor with no dimension]
[torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)]
```

There are a couple of issues with this:
- the no dimension thing is wrong, because empty variables now have size (0,)
- the double footer at the bottom is confusing because it's nested.

This changes the printing to more closely follow the dense printing:
```
>>> Variable(torch.sparse.FloatTensor(1,2,3))
Variable containing:
torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (1,2,3)
with indices:

[torch.LongTensor of size (0,)]
and values:

[torch.FloatTensor of size (0,)]
```
